channel.title: "Classic"
channel.description:
http://www.youtube.com/watch?v=YCU-qgR_4bM
Well out of the heap of shit that is published today its nice to see we still have the likes of rakim and krs one still around (Nas has always been around), pretty good song. Explains how hiphop [i]should[/i] be, with kanye playing the part of the modern day rapper. Though it is like a year old i've never heard it before now, which is a shame.
Oh and keep your "BLAH BLAH RAP IS SHIT LOLOLO" to yourself, because i don't care.

item.title: "Classic"
item.dc:creator: @Doggie3342 Doggie3342
item.description:
@Doggie3342 wrote:

good, but not quite up to my expectations after seeing the artists. none of them really were as good as they have been on other songs, but still pretty good. mos def is a fuckin beast, hes my favorite atm, im listening to mathematics right now.

item.title: "Classic"
item.dc:creator: @tL tL
item.description:
@tL wrote:

Yeah, i still can’t believe krs one is still active him being 42 years old 'n all and not turned into some pop faggot like snoop dog, come to think of it though rakim must be around 39 - 40 by now too.

Haha, first I was like KANYE?!?!?!

But it’s not as bad as I thought it would be. Prolly cuz KRS <3

item.title: "Classic"
item.dc:creator: @Rog3r Rog3r
item.description:
@Rog3r wrote:

I like the start as he is like mixing the tunes, and finally gets one going.

Also has a classic beat that reminds me of Fresh Prince of Bel-air style you know?

Then it slowly fades away, and becomes rap again… >.>
